title: Change in Tandem - info from table

content.question:
<math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>
<math alttext="1 less than x less than 2"><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></math>
<math alttext="2 less than x less than 3"><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></math>
<math alttext="3 less than x less than 4"><mn>3</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></math>
<math alttext="4 less than x less than 5"><mn>4</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></math>
Rate of change of <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
Positive and increasing
Negative and increasing 
Positive and decreasing 
Negative and decreasing

​The table gives characteristics of the rates of change of the function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> on different intervals. Which of the following is true about <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> on the interval <math alttext="3 less than x less than 4"><mn>3</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is increasing, and the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is concave down.
<math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is increasing, and the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is concave up.
<math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is decreasing, and the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is concave down.
<math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is decreasing, and the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is concave up.

content.answer: <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is increasing, and the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is concave down.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
